supahnickie.caffeine

Class CaffeineObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • supahnickie.caffeine.CaffeineObject

  • public class CaffeineObject
extends java.lang.Object
    CaffeineObject is the parent class of your application's model classes. It will also be the primary class with which you work while using the CaffeineORM. Any return object of type CaffeineObject can be cast to the appropriate concrete model class if needed.
    See Also:
    README containing examples, including initialization

      • init

        protected void init()
             throws java.lang.Exception

      • addIgnoredField

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> addIgnoredField(java.lang.String field)
        Adds a model attribute to the collection of other model attributes that should be ignored when returning CaffeineObjects from a query. Things that are not database attributes are good examples.
        Parameters:
        field - Model attribute to be added to the list of ignored attributes.
        Returns:
        List<String> containing the current list of ignored fields after adding.

      • setQueryClass

        public static final void setQueryClass(java.lang.Class klass)
        Prepares the CaffeineConnection class to assign attributes to instances of the correct class after a query. Calling any function that returns List<CaffeineObject> or CaffeineObject must first have the query class set properly.
        Parameters:
        klass - The actual class object that queries expect to use.

      • chainable

        public static final CaffeineChainable chainable()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes the CaffeineChainable class which can then be used to make ActiveRecord-like queries. This function signature assumes that the query class has already been set. If you need to change the active query class or if it has not been set already, pass the Class of the objects you would like to return in as an argument.
        Returns:
        An instance of the CaffeineChainable class from which you can join additional queries using the join(), where(), and or() methods, actually running the query with execute()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        setQueryClass(Class)

      • chainable

        public static final CaffeineChainable chainable(java.lang.Class klass)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes the CaffeineChainable class which can then be used to make ActiveRecord-like queries. If you need to change the active query class or if it has not been set already, pass the Class of the objects you would like to return in as an argument.
        Parameters:
        klass - The actual class object that queries expect to use.
        Returns:
        An instance of the CaffeineChainable class from which you can join additional queries using the join(), where(), and or() methods, actually running the query with execute()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        setQueryClass(Class)

      • find

        public static final CaffeineObject find(java.lang.Class klass,
                                        long i)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes an immediate find using id passed in as the lookup against the "id" column in the database.
        Parameters:
        klass - The actual class object that Caffeine should use.
        i - The integer (or long) representing the id to look up in the current query table.
        Returns:
        A CaffeineObject that can be cast to the class representing the object. An ID of 0 and other values set to null would mean the record was not found in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • find

        public static final CaffeineObject find(long i)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes an immediate find using id passed in as the lookup against the "id" column in the database. This function signature expects the current query class to already be set.
        Parameters:
        i - The integer (or long) representing the id to look up in the current query table.
        Returns:
        A CaffeineObject that can be cast to the class representing the object. An ID of 0 and other values set to null would mean the record was not found in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • save

        public final boolean save()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes either a create action on a new record or an update action on an existing, but changed record. The save() function calls either create() or update() as appropriate without needing the user to specify which action it should take.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether or not the record has been saved successfully into the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • create

        public static final CaffeineObject create(java.lang.Class klass,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Static version of the create function. Used when you do not have an instance in memory yet but would just like to create a new record.
        Parameters:
        klass - The actual class object that Caffeine should use.
        args - A map with the keys being the database columns and the values being the attribute values to write to the database and assign to the returned object.
        Returns:
        A CaffeineObject that can be cast to the class representing the object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • create

        public final CaffeineObject create()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Instance version of the create function. Used when you have an instance in memory already and would like to persist it in the database.
        Returns:
        A CaffeineObject that can be cast to the class representing the object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • update

        public final CaffeineObject update(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the row in the database this object represents with whatever new values it is passed in from the args.
        Parameters:
        args - A map with the keys being the database columns and the values being the attribute values to write to the database and assign to the returned object.
        Returns:
        A CaffeineObject that can be cast to the class representing the object. If the update fails, the calling object rolls back to its original state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • update

        public final CaffeineObject update()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the row in the database this object represents with whatever new values it currently has assigned to it.
        Returns:
        A CaffeineObject that can be cast to the class representing the object. If the update fails, the calling object rolls back to its original state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • delete

        public final boolean delete()
        Deletes an instance from the database using ID as its lookup.
        Returns:
        Boolean representing whether or not the record was successfully deleted.

      • getAssociated

        public final java.util.List<CaffeineObject> getAssociated(java.lang.Class associated)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Fetches associated records from a given instance using relationships defined in the extending model classes. For example, if a User has many Downloads, calling user.getAssociated(Download.class) would fetch the downloads that belong to them using the table name of the class as the foreign key lookup (in this case, "user_id" on the Downloads table).
        Parameters:
        associated - The class type of the records you would like to fetch.
        Returns:
        A list of the requested associated records. This is always a list, even when there's only one to return.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Relationships defined in sample User class.

      • getAssociated

        public final java.util.List<CaffeineObject> getAssociated(java.lang.Class associated,
                                                          java.lang.String foreignKey)
                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Fetches associated records from a given instance using relationships defined in the extending model classes. For example, if a User has many Downloads, calling user.getAssociated(Download.class, "organizer_id") would fetch the downloads where the user's id value is that of the download's organizer_id.
        Parameters:
        associated - The class type of the records you would like to fetch.
        foreignKey - The foreign key to use during the query.
        Returns:
        A list of the requested associated records. This is always a list, even when there's only one to return.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Relationships defined in sample User class.

      • isNewRecord

        public boolean isNewRecord()
        Returns true if the record has been newly instantiated and is not in the database yet.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • isDirty

        public boolean isDirty()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns true if the object has attributes that are different from when the object was instantiated. For example, retrieving a record from the database and calling isDirty() on it will return false, but if you change the object's firstName attribute, this will flip to true (and back to false if you change it back to what it started as).
        Returns:
        Boolean
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.String validationType)
        Function to be overwritten by the extending classes. Validate() is called before persisting records when the create() or update() methods are called.
        Parameters:
        validationType - Either "create" or "update" representing the action taken on the object.
        Returns:
        Boolean depending on whether or not the record passes validation in the model class.
        See Also:
        validate() defined in the User class.

      • getValidationErrors

        public final java.lang.String getValidationErrors()
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Fetches pertinent validation errors as reported in the validate() function.
        Returns:
        String of validation errors that are defined in the model classes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        validate() and validationErrors used in sample User class.
